title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Ethiopia (Social Policy and Evidence Social Inclusion)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Ethiopia: Formative evaluation of UNICEF Ethiopia Country Program Evaluation Report

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutional capacities for public finance management for children strengthened

description.narrative: During the 2016-2020 country programme UNICEF's presence and influence in public finance has been established with government and development partners. Effective partnerships with government and development partners have also been established. UNICEF Ethiopia continues to strengthen public finance monitoring, analysis and policy advocacy to better inform programme, policy and public budget decisions for the realization of children's rights. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Extent to which policy and budget frameworks address child poverty and disparities (score)

actual.value: 2020:4 A target of 3 means that the following score rating is achieved: “budget address child poverty and disparities, in at least three dimensions, in which budget allocations increase or are maintained” – and this has been achieved for these 4 dimensions or sectors, i.e. education, health, water and en

title.narrative: 4.9 Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning mechanisms for child/adolescent and/or community participation in local planning, budgeting and monitoring processes
Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures is publicly available
